author: Chris Bavin
method: Lightly grease a 33x23cm/13x9in baking tray that is about 3cm/1in deep. Line the greased tray with cling film. Place the oats and almonds in a food processor and blend for 10-20 seconds until fairly well broken down (if they are still whole, they won’t stick together, but you do want some texture). Pulse the mixture until slightly powdery. Tip into a large bowl then add the seeds, cranberries and rice pops and stir really well. Heat the agave, peanut butter and honey in a small saucepan over a medium heat until melted together. Pour this over the oat mixture then mix well with a spoon, until cooled slightly, then mix with your hands to make sure all the oats are coated in the peanut butter mixture. Tip into the tin and spread out evenly. Lay a sheet of cling film over the top, then press down firmly to squash the mixture flat. Leave in the freezer for 1 hour until set. Remove the top layer of cling film, then tip out onto a board, remove the remaining cling film and cut into 24 bars. To keep, layer them up between sheets of greaseproof paper and store in a sealed box in the fridge. They can also be kept in the freezer.
ingredients: 225g/8oz jumbo rolled oats,  50g/2oz almonds, skin on,  60g/2¼oz mixed seeds,  60g/2¼oz dried cranberries,  50g/2oz plain or chocolate rice pops,  100g/3½oz agave,  100g/3½oz peanut butter,  125g/4½oz honey
